text: Thornbury was a county constituency centred on the town of Thornbury in Gloucestershire. It returned one Member of Parliament to the House of Commons of the Parliament of the United Kingdom, elected by the first past the post voting system. ==History== The constituency was created by the Redistribution of Seats Act 1885 for the 1885 general election, and abolished for the 1950 general election. ==Boundaries== 1885–1918: The Sessional Divisions of Chipping Sodbury, Thornbury, and Lawford's Gate except the part included in the parliamentary borough of Bristol. 1918–1950: The Urban District of Kingswood, and the Rural Districts of Sodbury, Thornbury, and Warmley. ==Members of Parliament== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election !Member !Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1885 | Stafford Howard | Liberal |- |style="background-color: " | | 1886 | John Plunkett | Conservative |- |style="background-color: " | | 1892 | Charles Colston | Conservative |- |style="background-color: " | | 1906 | Athelstan Rendall | Liberal |- |style="background-color: " | | 1922 | Herbert Charles Woodcock | Conservative |- |style="background-color: " | | 1923 | Athelstan Rendall | Liberal |- |style="background-color: " | | 1924 | Sir Derrick Gunston, Bt. | Unionist |- |style="background-color: " | | 1945 | Joseph Alpass | Labour |- | |1950 |colspan="2"| constituency abolished |} ==Elections== ===Elections in the 1880s=== ===Elections in the 1890s=== Colston Allen ===Elections in the 1900s=== ===Elections in the 1910s=== George Cockerill General Election 1914/15: Another General Election was required to take place before the end of 1915. The political parties had been making preparations for an election to take place and by July 1914, the following candidates had been selected; *Liberal: Athelstan Rendall *Unionist: George CockerillStandard 21 June 1913 Athelstan Rendall === Elections in the 1920s === === Elections in the 1930s === General Election 1939/40: Another General Election was required to take place before the end of 1940. The political parties had been making preparations for an election to take place and by the Autumn of 1939, the following candidates had been selected; *Conservative: Derrick Gunston *Labour: Joseph AlpassReport of the Annual Conference of the Labour Party, 1939 *Liberal: Raymond WaltonGloucestershire Echo, 9 May 1938 === Elections in the 1940s === ==References== Category:Parliamentary constituencies in South West England (historic) Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies established in 1885 Category:United Kingdom Parliamentary constituencies disestablished in 1950 Category:Politics of Gloucestershire Category:Thornbury, Gloucestershire
title: Thornbury (UK Parliament constituency)
